jmortgage
Class JMortgageFactory

java.lang.Object
  jmortgage.JMortgageFactory

public class JMortgageFactory
extends Object

Factory class that builds implementations for all interfaces defined in JMortgage. Uses reflection to build implementations. This ensures that future implementations of the interfaces can be instantiated by this factory class. Also, has convenience methods to implement instances of the default implementations of the JMortgage interfaces. Uses Apache's common collections object InstantiateFactory to create objects via reflection.

Since:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

Constructor Detail

JMortgageFactory

public JMortgageFactory()
Method Detail

getPmtCalculator

public static PmtCalculator getPmtCalculator(Class instance,
                                             Class[] classes,
                                             Object[] args)
Builds an implementation of PmtCalculator using reflection.

To build DefaultPmtCalculator using this method:

 PmtCalculator pmtCalculator = JMortgageFactory.getPmtCalculator(
  jmortgage.payment.DefaultPmtCalculator.class,
  new Class[] {Interval.class, Double.class, Double.class, Integer.class},
  new Object[] { Interval.Monthly, (double)100000, 5.75, 360 });

Parameters:
instance - The class of the implementation of PmtCalculator to instantiate.
classes - The constructor parameter types. The array of classes must be in the same order as the array of object arguments and they must equal in number.
args - The constructor arguments.
Returns:
PmtCalculator instantiation

getPmtCalculator

public static PmtCalculator getPmtCalculator(Class instance)
Builds an implementation of PmtCalculator using reflection using its empty constructor if it has one.

Parameters:
instance - The class of the implementation of PmtCalculator to instantiate.
Returns:
PmtCalculator instantiation

getDefaultPmtCalculator

public static PmtCalculator getDefaultPmtCalculator(Interval interval,
                                                    double loanAmt,
                                                    double interestRate,
                                                    int years)
Convenience method for creating a DefaultPmtCalculator.

Parameters:
interval - interval to be used to calculate the payment. Valid values are Monthly, Biweekly, and Weekly.
loanAmt - loan amount used to calculate the payment.
interestRate - the interest rate used to calculate the payment.
years - the number of years in the mortgage term.
Returns:
PmtCalculator instantiation, in this case, DefaultPmtCalculator

getDefaultExtraPmt

public static ExtraPmt getDefaultExtraPmt(PmtKey pmtKey,
                                          int count,
                                          double amount)
Convenience method for creating a DefaultExtraPmt

Parameters:
pmtKey - The PmtKey object to be used to build the DefaultExtraPmt. The interval value in the PmtKey is the interval in which to apply the extra payments. Valid values are Monthly, Biweekly, Weekly, Yearly, and OneTime.
count - The count of consecutive payments to which to apply the extra payment.
amount - The amount of the extra payment.
Returns:
ExtraPmt instantiation, in this case, DefaultExtraPmt

                               throws ParseException

getDefaultExtraPmtMapBuilder

public static ExtraPmtMapBuilder getDefaultExtraPmtMapBuilder(PmtKey pmtKey,
                                                              int years)
Convenience method for creating a DefaultExtraPmtMapBuilder. An Interval object is not passed in and defaults to Monthly.

Parameters:
pmtKey - The pmtKey to be used to create the ExtraPmtMapBuilder
years - The years in the mortgage term for which to build the ExtraPmtMapBuilder
Returns:
ExtraPmtMapBuilder instantiation, in this case, DefaultExtraPmtMapBuilder

getDefaultPMICalculator

public static DefaultPMICalculator getDefaultPMICalculator(double fivePctDivider,
                                                           double tenPctDivider,
                                                           double fifteenPctDivider)
Convenience method for creating a DefaultPMICalculator.

Parameters:
fivePctDivider - the amount to divide the loan amount by if the total percent of money down is less than 10 percent
tenPctDivider - the amount to divide the loan amount by if the total percent of money down is less than 15 percent and more than or equal to 10 percent
fifteenPctDivider - the amount to divide the loan amount by if the total percent of money down is less than 20 percent and more than or equal to 15 percent.
Returns:
PMICalculator instantiation, in this case, DefaultPMICalculator
Since:
1.2
